search.query: |mstats count(*) where index=$index_name$ earliest=$Time_range.earliest$ by cluster_id | table cluster_id

chart.title: The total number of open SQL Sessions across all nodes.

search.query: | mstats latest(sql_conns) as sql_conns WHERE index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ span=10s by net.host.name | timechart span=10s latest(sql_conns) by net.host.name

chart.title: The total number of open SQL transactions across all nodes.

search.query: | mstats sum(sql_txns_open) as sql_txns_open where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ span=10s |timechart span=10s sum(sql_txns_open) as open_transactions

chart.title: The total number of running SQL statements across all nodes.

search.query: | mstats sum(sql_distsql_queries_active) as x WHERE index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ span=10s | timechart span=10s sum(x) as active_statements

chart.title: The total amount of SQL client network traffic in bytes per second across all nodes.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(sql_bytesin) as bytes_in, rate_sum(sql_bytesout) as bytes_out WHERE index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ span=10s | eval bytes_in=round(bytes_in/1024, 2), bytes_out=round(bytes_out/1024, 2) | timechart span=10s sum(bytes_in) as bytes_in, sum(bytes_out) as bytes_out

chart.title: A ten-second moving average of the # of SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE statements successfully executed per second across all nodes.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(sql_select_count) as select, rate_sum(sql_insert_count) as insert, rate_sum(sql_update_count) as update, rate_sum(sql_delete_count) as delete where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ span=10s

chart.title: The number of statements which returned a planning or runtime error.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(sql_failure_count) as x WHERE index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ span=10s | timechart span=10s sum(x) as errors

chart.title: The total number of SQL statements that experienced contention across all nodes.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(sql_distsql_contended_queries_count) as contention WHERE index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ span=10s | timechart span=10s sum(contention) as contention

chart.title: The total number of full table/index scans across all nodes.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(sql_full_scan_count) as x WHERE index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ span=10s by net.host.name | timechart sum(x) span=10s by net.host.name

panel.title: Active Flows for Distributed SQL Statements

chart.title: The number of flows on each node contributing to currently running distributed SQL statements.

search.query: | mstats sum(sql_distsql_flows_active) as x where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ span=10s by net.host.name |timechart span=10s latest(x) by net.host.name

chart.title: Over the last minute, this node established and authenticated 99% of connections within this time.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(sql_conn_latency_bucket) as x where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ by net.host.name, _timeseries, le span=10s | stats sum(x) as x by net.host.name, _time, le | `histperc(0.99, x, le, "net.host.name,_time")` | eval histperc=round(histperc/1000/1000, 2) | timechart span=10s latest(histperc) by net.host.name

chart.title: Over the last minute, this node established and authenticated 90% of connections within this time.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(sql_conn_latency_bucket) as x where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ by net.host.name, _timeseries, le span=10s | stats sum(x) as x by net.host.name, _time, le | `histperc(0.90, x, le, "net.host.name,_time")` | eval histperc=round(histperc/1000/1000, 2) | timechart span=10s latest(histperc) by net.host.name

chart.title: Over the last minute, this node executed 99% of SQL statements within this time. This time only includes SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE and DELETE statements and does not include network latency between the node and client.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(sql_service_latency_bucket) as x where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ by net.host.name, _timeseries, le span=10s | stats sum(x) as x by net.host.name, _time, le | `histperc(0.99, x, le, "net.host.name,_time")` | eval histperc=round(histperc/1000/1000, 2) | timechart span=10s latest(histperc) by net.host.name

chart.title: Over the last minute, this node executed 90% of SQL statements within this time. This time only includes SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE and DELETE statements and does not include network latency between the node and client.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(sql_service_latency_bucket) as x where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ by net.host.name, _timeseries, le span=10s | stats sum(x) as x by net.host.name, _time, le | `histperc(0.9, x, le, "net.host.name,_time")` | eval histperc=round(histperc/1000/1000, 2) | timechart span=10s latest(histperc) by net.host.name

chart.title: The 99th percentile of latency between query requests and responses over a 1 minute period. Values are displayed individually for each node.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(exec_latency_bucket) as x where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ by net.host.name, _timeseries, le span=10s | stats sum(x) as x by net.host.name, _time, le | `histperc(0.99, x, le, "net.host.name,_time")` | eval histperc=round(histperc/1000/1000, 2) | timechart span=10s latest(histperc) by net.host.name

chart.title: The 90th percentile of latency between query requests and responses over a 1 minute period. Values are displayed individually for each node.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(exec_latency_bucket) as x where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ by net.host.name, _timeseries, le span=10s | stats sum(x) as x by net.host.name, _time, le | `histperc(0.90, x, le, "net.host.name,_time")` | eval histperc=round(histperc/1000/1000, 2) | timechart span=10s latest(histperc) by net.host.name

chart.title: The total number of transactions initiated, committed, rolled back, or aborted per second across all nodes.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(sql_txn_begin_count) as begin, rate_sum(sql_txn_commit_count) as commit, rate_sum(sql_txn_rollback_count) as rollback, rate_sum(sql_txn_abort_count) as abort where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ span=10s |timechart span=10s sum(begin) as begin, sum(commit) as commit, sum(rollback) as rollback, sum(abort) as abort

chart.title: The number of transactions restarted broken down by errors across all nodes. Refer to the transaction retry error reference documentation for more details.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(txn_restarts_asyncwritefailure) as async_failure, rate_sum(txn_restarts_writetooold_count) as write_too_old, rate_sum(txn_restarts_commitdeadlineexceeded_count) as commit_deadline_exceeded , rate_sum(txn_restarts_readwithinuncertainty_count) as read_within_uncertainty_interval, rate_sum(txn_restarts_txnaborted_count) as aborted , rate_sum(txn_restarts_txnpush_count) as push_failure , rate_sum(txn_restarts_unknown_count) as unknown, rate_sum(txn_restarts_serializable_count) as forwarded_timestamp where index=$index_name$ span=10s | timechart span=10s sum(async_failure) as async_failure, sum(write_too_old) as write_too_old, sum(write_too_old_multi) as write_too_old_multi, sum(commit_deadline_exceeded) as commit_deadline_exceeded, sum(read_within_uncertainty) as read_within_uncertainty_interval, sum(aborted) as aborted, sum(push_failure) as push_failure, sum(unknown) as unknown, sum(forwarded_timestamp) as forwarded_timestamp_iso_serializable

chart.title: Over the last minute, this node executed 99% of transactions within this time.This time does not include network latency between the node and client.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(sql_txn_latency_bucket) as x where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ by net.host.name, _timeseries, le span=10s | stats sum(x) as x by net.host.name, _time, le | `histperc(0.99, x, le, "net.host.name,_time")` | eval histperc=round(histperc/1000/1000, 2) | timechart span=10s latest(histperc) by net.host.name

chart.title: Over the last minute, this node executed 90% of transactions within this time.This time does not include network latency between the node and client.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(sql_txn_latency_bucket) as x where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ by net.host.name, _timeseries, le span=10s | stats sum(x) as x by net.host.name, _time, le | `histperc(0.9, x, le, "net.host.name,_time")` | eval histperc=round(histperc/1000/1000, 2) | timechart span=10s latest(histperc) by net.host.name

chart.title: The current amount of allocated SQL memory. This amount is compared against the node's --max-sql-memory flag.

search.query: | mstats latest(sql_mem_root_current) as x where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ span=10s by net.host.name | eval x=round(x/1024/1024, 2) | timechart span=10s latest(x) as sql_memory by net.host.name

chart.title: The total number of DDL statements per second across all nodes.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(sql_ddl_count) as x where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ span=10s | timechart sum(x) as ddl_statements span=10s

chart.title: The total number of statements denied per second across all nodes due to a cluster setting in the format feature.statement_type.enabled = FALSE.

search.query: | mstats rate_sum(sql_feature_flag_denial) as x where index=$index_name$ AND cluster_id=$cluster_id$ span=10s | timechart span=10s sum(x) as statements_denied
